ai.summary: A demanding 31 km coastal hike along the Wick to Keiss section of the John O'Groats Trail in northern Scotland. The route follows rugged cliff paths, remote shoreline and exposed moorland, requiring good navigation, solid footwear and endurance.
ai.terrain_summary: Rugged coastal terrain with rocky cliff tops, uneven paths, boggy or grassy sections and occasional beach crossings. Footing can be loose, wet or eroded; expect exposed sections with strong winds and limited protection from the elements.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for a remote coastal route with few services and limited mobile reception. Start early to ensure daylight and know the tide and weather forecasts. Carry navigation tools (map, compass, and GPS), a fully charged phone, sufficient water and food, a first aid kit, and emergency waterproof layer. Wear sturdy boots, stay aware of weather changes, and be prepared for long stretches with no shelter. Inform someone of your plans and consider a personal locator beacon for added safety.
recommended_gear: Sturdy waterproof hiking boots with good ankle support
Warm layers (fleece or wool), hat and gloves
Map, compass and/or GPS; fully charged phone
Water supply (2–3 L) and high-energy snacks
Small first aid kit and blister care
Headlamp or flashlight with extra batteries
Emergency whistle and personal locator beacon (optional)
Backpack with dry bag or waterproof cover
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (roughly May to September) offers the mildest weather and longest daylight. Shoulder seasons (April or October) are possible but can bring stronger winds and more unsettled conditions; winter hiking is not recommended for most hikers due to short days and severe weather.

seo.title: John O'Groats Trail Wick to Keiss – 31 km Coastal Hike in Scotland
seo.meta_description: Explore the challenging Wick to Keiss section of the John O'Groats Trail, a 31 km coastal route in northern Scotland. Learn terrain, safety tips and gear for this demanding hike.
seo.h1: John O'Groats Trail Wick to Keiss: 31 km Coastal Challenge
